text: John Prine (October 10, 1946 â€“ April 7, 2020) was an American country folk singer-songwriter and guitarist. He was born in Maywood, Illinois but raised in Chicago. His music was often seen as protest and social commentary. He began making music for Atlantic Records in 1971. In 1984 he co-founded Oh Boy Records, an independent record label. In 1992 and 2006, Prine won a Grammy Award. ==Later life== In 1998, he was diagnosed with a form of melanoma in the neck. In 2013, he discovered he had lung cancer. On March 26, 2020, Prine was hospitalized with COVID-19. Two days later, his health was reported as critical. On April 7, 2020, he died of the disease in Nashville, Tennessee. He was 73. ==Discography== ;Studio albums *The Missing Years (1991 ) *The Tree of Forgiveness (2018) ==References== Category:American Grammy Award winners Category:1946 births Category:2020 deaths Category:Country musicians from Illinois Category:American country guitarists Category:American folk singers Category:American folk musicians Category:American activists Category:Businesspeople from Chicago Category:Deaths from the COVID-19 pandemic in Tennessee Category:Infectious disease deaths in Tennessee Category:Musicians from Chicago Category:Singer-songwriters from Chicago
title: John Prine
